4efd0634-1c98-46cb-98ea-d7547fc4c2b7.description: The IMC is the benchmark entry-level qualification into the UK investment profession. It delivers the threshold competency knowledge required by investment professionals involved in portfolio management, research analysis, and other front office investment activities. The examinations cover the key content areas appropriate for these roles including economics, accounting, investment practice, regulation, and ethics.
4efd0634-1c98-46cb-98ea-d7547fc4c2b7.name: Investment Management Certificate (IMC)

issuer.summary: issued by CFA Society United Kingdom

badge_template_activities.title: To complete the IMC qualification a candidate must pass two examinations - IMC Unit 1: The Investment Environment and IMC Unit 2: Investment Practice.  A candidate must demonstrate knowledge and understanding across the entire IMC syllabus.

In order to pass the IMC Investment Environment examination, candidates must have studied the CFA UK official course materials, covering the following syllabus topics: •Financial Markets and Institutions •Ethics and Investment Professionalism •The Regulation of Financial Markets and Institutions •Legal Concepts •Client Advice •Taxation in the UK.

In order to pass the IMC Investment Practice examination, candidates must have studied the CFA UK official course materials, covering the following syllabus topics: •Quantitative Methods •Micro-economics •Macro-economics •Accounting •Equities •Fixed Income •Derivatives •Alternative Investments •Portfolio Management •Investment Products •Investment Performance Management.

0a835b34-de00-445a-910c-b85195213f60.description: The CFA UK Certificate in Climate and Investing is a Level 4 qualification which delivers the knowledge and skills required by investment professionals to understand climate as it relates to investing and how to integrate climate change considerations into the investment process. The first qualification in the UK designed specifically by investment practitioners for investment practitioners.
0a835b34-de00-445a-910c-b85195213f60.name: Certificate in Climate and Investing

issuer.summary: issued by CFA Society United Kingdom

badge_template_activities.title: The Certificate in Climate and Investing consists of a single, standalone examination unit which candidates must pass in order to achieve the qualification. The examination is 2 hours and 20 minutes in length and consists of 100 multiple choice questions (including short and long scenario item set questions).

In order to pass the examination, candidates must have studied the CFA UK official course materials, covering the following syllabus topics: • Introduction to Climate & Investing• Climate Science & Climate Risks & Considerations • Regulation, Policy Response & the Corporate Reporting Landscape • Climate Change Impacts & Opportunities• Climate Risk Measurement• Stewardship & Engagement on Climate• Portfolio Management (listed and private markets)• Serving Client Needs

skills.name: Climate Change and Listed Investment Instruments
Climate Change and Private Market Instruments
Climate Change and Serving Client Needs

632c27f2-952e-412a-ad39-530572ce8f7a.description: CFA UK Young Women in Investment Programme launched in 2022 in the UK in partnership with CFA UK Institute to provide recent female graduates with the opportunity to grow the skills required to enter the investment industry. Participants take part in a four-week learning programme instructed by Fitch Learning to give a comprehensive overview of the investment profession.
632c27f2-952e-412a-ad39-530572ce8f7a.name: Young Women in Investment

issuer.summary: issued by CFA Society United Kingdom

badge_template_activities.title: Attendance of a four-week bootcamp. Participants must actively take part in the sessions and pose questions. • Participation in the ESG Research Challenge. Participants must work in a group to research the impact of ESG on the investment industry. Teams then present their findings and explain how they can be used by a firm as part of their future strategy. • Participation in the Investment Challenge. Teams create a report and summarise their findings, outlining the approach and assumptions

12145ceb-c850-4bee-8599-f3a37cbe9ae7.description: CFA UK Ethical Leadership Programme provides senior level participants with the knowledge and techniques required to develop practical ethical decision-making skills. Bringing together challenges to explore complex scenarios around personal morals, corporate responsibility to help create sustainable and resilient leaders. Designed by leading senior investment professionals and the CFA UK Advisory Council, delivered in conjunction with Duke CE.
12145ceb-c850-4bee-8599-f3a37cbe9ae7.name: Ethical Leadership Programme

issuer.summary: issued by CFA Society United Kingdom

badge_template_activities.title: The CFA UK Ethical Leadership Programme consists of three-day module-based practical learning sessions led by qualified instructors. Participants must prepare and demonstrate skills learnt through debate, case study creation, presentation and are verbally tested on outcome based key learnings.

In order to pass the course participants must have studied the programme materials provided during the course modules covering topics: ethical dilemmas, cultural setting, diversity & inclusion, societal responsibility, personal values, integrity and purpose.
